name: Crédit Agricole d'Aquitaine
description:
La Caisse Régionale d’Aquitaine est le fruit du regroupement, officialisé le 21 mai 2001, des caisses régionales de la Gironde, du Lot et Garonne et du Sud Ouest.
La volonté de développer des relations toujours plus étroites avec notre clientèle et d’être toujours plus utile pour nos territoires, associée à celle d’améliorer la qualité de nos services ont été les ferments à l’origine de cette opération.

CHARTE DE BONNE CONDUITE
A DESTINATION DES UTILISATEURS DE LA PAGE FACEBOOK DU CREDIT AGRICOLE AQUITAINE

L’espace Facebook de la Caisse régionale de Crédit Agricole Mutuel d’Aquitaine est un espace d’échange d’idées, d’opinions, qui s’inscrit dans un respect mutuel des membres, de la Caisse Régionale et de ses salariés. L’objectif de cette page est de vous faire découvrir l’actualité de notre marque et de notre Caisse Régionale.  Il n’est pas de traiter les éventuels litiges que vous pourriez avoir avec notre Caisse Régionale ou une autre Caisse Régionale ou entité du groupe Crédit Agricole. Néanmoins, nous prenons en compte vos demandes et les redirigeons vers les bons interlocuteurs pour leur traitement.
Par ailleurs, nous vous rappelons que votre conseiller, le directeur d’agence et le médiateur de votre Caisse régionale (dont les coordonnées se trouvent sur votre relevé bancaire) sont à votre disposition pour répondre à vos demandes. De plus, nous avons mis en place le site www.dites-le-nous.com, un espace de dialogue qui a pour vocation de prendre en compte vos idées, vos témoignages et vos questions.
N’hésitez pas à partager vos expériences, poser des questions et répondre aux questions.
La participation aux échanges sur cette page est ouverte à tous. Nous vous invitons à consulter et respecter les règles de bonne conduite ci-dessous avant toute contribution. La participation des membres à cette page Facebook peut faire l’objet d’une modération a posteriori. Si, après publication, le modérateur estime qu’un commentaire ou toute autre forme de participation n’est pas conforme à la loi française ou aux règles de bonne conduite ci-dessous, il se réserve le droit de supprimer cette contribution sans préavis.

    * Toute contribution d’un membre qui serait contraire aux lois françaises sera supprimé, notamment:
    * Les messages haineux, agressifs ou incitant à la discrimination, y compris les insinuations, à caractère racistes, xénophobes, portant sur la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l’âge ou l’orientation/identité sexuelle ainsi que les propos obscènes ou pornographiques ;

2. Les propos diffamatoires ou injurieux à l’égard de toute personne morale ou physique, notamment envers le personnel du groupe Crédit Agricole ;
3. Tout message qui relèverait du harcèlement à l’égard de toute personne physique ;
4. Tout lien hypertexte renvoyant vers des sites extérieurs dont le contenu serait susceptible d’être contraire aux lois et règlements en vigueur en France ou tout lien hypertexte intégré par un membre qui n’en aurait pas l’autorisation;
5. Toute contribution qui serait protégée par le droit d’auteur (type photo, base de données) ou/et le droit des marques (type logo, marque) et qui serait reproduite et diffusée sur la page Facebook par un membre sans qu’il en détienne les droits d’utilisation ;
6. Tout message comprenant des données à caractère personnel (par exemple nom, numéro de téléphone, adresse), notamment, la mention de coordonnées personnelles par un membre est interdite s’il ne s’agit pas de ses propres coordonnées personnelles dont il prend la responsabilité de la diffusion ;
7. Tout message contrevenant au droit à la vie privée et au droit à l’image ;
8. Tout message communiqué par un membre qui usurperait l’identité d’une autre personne physique;
9. Tout message qui enfreindrait toute autre disposition législative ou règlementaire en vigueur en France.
10 .Vos critiques nous intéressent afin d'établir un échange constructif et d'améliorer nos produits et nos services.  Cependant, tout message de dénigrement pouvant mener au discrédit des produits et services proposés par une entité du groupe Crédit Agricole constituant un trouble manifestement illicite ou tout message pouvant constituer une concurrence déloyale sera supprimé

 

    * Les participants sont également invités à respecter les règles de bonne conduite suivantes :

1. Dans la mesure du possible, nous vous demandons d’écrire vos commentaires dans un français correct favorisant la compréhension et l’échange.

    * Pour veiller à la qualité des débats,  nous vous demandons de ne pas communiquer sur cette page Facebook des contributions à caractère indigne ou attentatoires aux personnes (type acharnement contre un participant).
    * Ne donnez jamais vos coordonnées bancaires sur une page Facebook : le Crédit Agricole ne vous demandera jamais ces informations sur Internet, y compris par mail.

4. Avant de poster un commentaire, vérifiez s'il correspond bien au sujet de discussion. Les contributions superflues ou redondantes sans apport particulier pour les échanges ainsi que tout message hors sujet pourront être supprimés par le modérateur, de même que l’intégration de liens hypertexte inappropriés.
5. Si vous répondez à un commentaire, indiquez le nom du contributeur auquel vous répondez ou citez le texte original dans un souci de bonne compréhension. L’écriture du type @lenomdelapersonne est acceptée.
6. Vérifiez la source des informations que vous postez afin d’éviter la désinformation et les rumeurs. Si vous avez un doute sur une information publiée sur le compte du Crédit Agricole, n’hésitez pas à nous questionner. 
7. Prenez garde à ne pas perdre votre temps à engager le débat avec des trolls. Un "troll" est un individu qui persiste à lancer des discussions sur des sujets qui fâchent ou à semer la zizanie entre les participants.
8. Si vous souhaitez attirer notre attention sur un sujet ou aborder une problématique particulière avec notre banque, nous vous recommandons d’expliquer votre situation sans entrer dans les détails. Nous prendrons contact avec vous par messagerie privée et identifierons votre agence de rattachement afin de les informer de votre cas et/ou de vous redirigez vers elle. De plus, nous vous rappelons que le site www.dites-le-nous.com est l’espace de dialogue à privilégier pour soumettre vos idées, vos témoignages et vos questions. Nous vous rappelons que les données nominatives des salariés du groupe Crédit Agricole ne doivent pas être communiquées ni toute autre information qui permettrait d’identifier l’une de ces personnes physiques.
9. Vous pouvez demander à tout moment à ce que les informations vous concernant soient supprimées.
10. Comme tous les espaces de discussion virtuels, vos propos publiés sur cette page Facebook http://www.facebook.com/pages/Cr%C3%A9dit-Agricole-dAquitaine/246847305421128  sont publics, donc accessibles à tous. Il n’est pas nécessaire d’être membre du réseau Facebook ou de la pagehttp://www.facebook.com/pages/Cr%C3%A9dit-Agricole-dAquitaine/246847305421128 pour les lire. Ils peuvent être produits dans le cadre d'une procédure judiciaire, tenez-en compte.
11. Toute utilisation du site à des fins publicitaires ou commerciales est proscrite : cette page est un lieu d’échanges d’idées, de suggestions et d’opinions.
La Caisse Régionale n’est pas responsable des propos tenus par les membres de cette page Facebook mais s’engage à modérer les échanges selon les règles précitées.
N’hésitez pas à informer la Caisse Régionale en cas de détection de contributions ne respectant pas cette Charte de bonne conduite à l’adresse suivante : Crédit Agricole d’Aquitaine Service Communication, 304 boulevard du Président Wilson 33076 BORDEAUX Cedex. Vous pouvez poser vos questions sur cet espace de discussion ou nous contacter par e-mail : redaction@ca-aquitaine.fr

name: Credit Solution Program

The results of my research are available for free on our site through our easy to follow short videos.

name: Virginia Credit Union
description:
Virginia Credit Union does not assume any responsibility for user privacy while on our Facebook page. Please do not share personal information, account numbers, or other identifying information in comments or posts. Virginia Credit Union reserves the right to remove posts at its discretion. For individual questions, please call (804) 323-6800 or contact Virginia Credit Union by secure e-mail: https://www.vacu.org/applications/email/secure_email.aspx

Here are some suggestions for VACU members who use social networks:

1. Be mindful of your content. Remember that the information you post is permanent. Depending on privacy settings, it may be visible not only to your own network but potentially to the network of your friends. Be careful.

2.Only read emails from people who are truly your friends.

3.Secure your account with a strong password.

4.Lock down your privacy controls to a level of least privilege. For Facebook, set everything to “Friends Only.”

5.Make sure you know who you are friending.

6.Make sure you run anti-virus software on your personal computer and keep the software up to date.

7.Apply operating system patches as they become available to ensure you are protected from known security flaws.

8.Secure your password and user ID.

name: Idaho Central Credit Union
description:
Idaho Central Credit Union was organized as a state-chartered credit union on June 28, 1940, in Boise, Idaho, to serve the financial needs of the officers of other credit unions operating in the State of Idaho. At that time, officers could not belong to the credit union where they worked. On January 31, 1941, the Credit Union reported $298.93 in assets at year end and had 22 members.
  
In 1952, Idaho Central changed its field of membership to include all members of other Idaho credit unions. By 1977, the Credit Union reached 10,000 in active members and had branches in Pocatello and Boise, Idaho. During that same year, the field of membership was modified again to include retail employees in Ada, Bannock, Bingham, and Power Counties.
  
Idaho Central reached $100 million in assets in 1997, and $500 million nine years later in 2006. By 2015, the Credit Union reached over $2 billion in asset size. Idaho Central serves the needs of over 200,000 members including employees, students, retirees, and family members of eligible members of a large variety of business entities within most Idaho counties.
 
Headquartered in Chubbuck, Idaho, Idaho Central is the largest credit union in Idaho and offers 26 full-service locations throughout the Treasure Valley, Magic Valley, Eastern and Northern Idaho. We continue to look for expansion opportunities in order to meet the needs of our members. While growth is vital to our success, we remain focused on our mission, “Helping members achieve financial success,” by providing exceptional service and diverse products to our membership.

Apply for membership today and experience the Credit Union difference!

name: Creditseva
description:
What is CreditSeva? 

Quick, comfortable and easy to use, CreditSeva™ is your financial friend. This dream venture was started by a group of young, zealous and dynamic entrepreneurs with a go-get-it attitude. All of us are aware of the fact that the world of credit is perplexing and mystifying. However, with the help of our tool we strive to make it simple, so that consumers can understand the complexities in the credit instruments and their resultant credit scores to take better financial decisions. 

As the punch line goes “Managing Credit Simplified,” we have ensured that the service offered is very simple and easy for normal consumers to use. With an innovative mind-set, our team hopes to bring in a radical change in the field of finance and credit. Our new-fangled and avant-grade tool will help people assess their credit profile themselves, negotiate settlements, track and rectify errors, set reminders for payments, , etc.; which in turn, will help them better manage their credit. 

Whether you manage projects for clients or you are self-employed or you work with one of the best Fortune 500 Companies, CreditSeva™ has integrations and features that will best match every individual’s requirement. This we ensure because we strongly wish to bring about “Innovation in Creditability,” wherein our innovative products will help in maximizing the creditability of our customers.

How CreditSeva™ was born?

The idea of this venture was conceptualized by a team of finance geeks! We befriended thousands of consumers in improving their credit score because we firmly believe that if our helping hand could make someone realise their dreams, then we shall be glad that we somewhere played a small part in their success story. 

With a leading-edge thought and ingenious tools, CreditSeva™ team abides by the fact – “Your Need, Our Inspiration!” and in our opinion these small efforts we put in will help people build a bright future.

name: Crédit Agricole Egypt

As a committed bank, Crédit Agricole Egypt’s key goal is its customers’ satisfaction by valuing and prioritizing their best interests. Thus, Crédit Agricole Egypt has created specialized segments to cater its customers’ needs by offering the sound advice and tailored financial solutions. 

يعد كريدي أجريكول مصر أحد البنوك التابعة لمجموعة كريدي أجريكول العالمية وهي إحدى المؤسسات المالية الرائدة في فرنسا والعالم في جميع مجال الخدمات البنكية والتي تتمحور استراتيجيتيها حول العميل.

تأسس كريدي أجريكول مصر في عام 2006. ومنذ انطلاقه في السوق المصرية، أصبح من أهم البنوك العاملة في القطاع المصرفي المصري، حيث يقدم لعملائه مجموعة متكاملة من المنتجات والخدمات المبتكرة في كافة المجالات سواء للشركات، المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة، أو للتجزئة المصرفية للأفراد. ويعد الهدف الرئيسي لكريدي أجريكول مصر هو تحقيق رضاء عملائه، من خلال اعطاء الأولوية لهم ولتعظيم مصالحهم ، لذا فقد قام كريدي أجريكول مصر بتخصيص قطاعات مختلفة لتلبي كل منها احتياجات قطاع محدد من العملاء عن طريق تقديم الخبرة والاستشارة والحلول المصرفية المصممة خصيصا لهم.

name: The Credits
description: The Credits is a digital magazine that celebrates our large and diverse creative community. We pull the curtain back to provide you with an inside look at the hard work that goes into producing the movies and TV shows that you love.

name: Reduce Credit Card Debt
description:
Founded by Justin Fox, the co-creator of the successful Fox Symes debt relief business, Reduce Credit Card Debt offers a better alternative to the current debt solutions available in the market place today. Justin believes that support and the personal attention he gives to his clients is just as important as lowering their debt.

In July 2011, Justin created Bradfield Bentley www.bradfieldbentley.com.au, to offer a more dedicated and personal debt collections servicing company to help those in financial need. Over the years he has seen Australia’s credit card debt climb higher and higher and decided to create Reduce Credit Card Debt to focus solely on aiding Australians in financial distress through credit card debt.

What does Reduce Credit Card Debt do? Simple. We talk to you, we listen to you and we help you. In most cases where possible, we negotiate down your debt and achieve a full settlement of your account.

We hate the thought of people having their lives ruined by debt and we understand the burden and stress that having credit card debt can have on your life. We find ways that can help you get out of your debt after learning about your individual situation.

We talk to the banks and credit card companies and negotiate a reduced settlement amount for you. In many cases we have reduced people’s debt completely and on average we reduce people’s credit card debt by 40% to 70%.

Imagine how different your life would be if your debt was reduced by up to 70%? Call us today to make the change you need to become debt free. Call 1300 135 695.

Il accompagne ses clients dans leurs projets et met à leur disposition la diversité de ses expertises.
Premier employeur privé, il embauche chaque année une centaine de collaborateurs en CDI.
Proximité, responsabilité et solidarité sont ses valeurs fondatrices qui l’animent au quotidien.
 
Son ancrage régional lui permet de soutenir de nombreux projets d’initiatives locales (près de 500 projets en 2012) et ses actions de mécénat illustrent son attachement à la préservation et à l’animation de son territoire.
 
Grâce aux nombreux partenariats répartis sur toute la Basse-Normandie, le Crédit Agricole Normandie vous propose de nombreux jeux concours pour vous faire gagner des places pour différents événements sportifs ou culturels : foot, basket, concerts,…

Home > Inps Comunica> I Social network Inps > Social Media Policy), non potranno essere trattati casi personali o singole pratiche. name: Crédit Mutuel de Bretagne
description:
Fondé en 1926, le CMB  est l’une des Fédérations du Crédit Mutuel Arkéa. 
Les valeurs de solidarité, d’équité, de proximité sont constitutives de son ADN.
Bancassureur de plus d’un Breton sur deux, le Crédit Mutuel de Bretagne s’engage chaque jour auprès de 1,8 million de sociétaires et clients.
Présent sur les quatre départements bretons - Côtes-d’Armor, Finistère, Ille-et-Vilaine et Morbihan -, le Crédit Mutuel de Bretagne s’appuie sur un très fort ancrage territorial grâce à son réseau de 226 caisses locales et 356 points d’accueil, de conseil et d’expertise au service des particuliers, des professionnels, des entreprises, des associations et des collectivités.
Depuis toujours, le Crédit Mutuel de Bretagne met à profit ses innovations technologiques pour faciliter et simplifier le quotidien de sa clientèle. Son site Internet cmb.fr et ses applications mobiles permettent à ses clients d’avoir accès à l’ensemble des produits et services de banque à distance.

Faisant corps avec sa région, le Crédit Mutuel de Bretagne revendique fièrement son statut de banque territoriale. Il participe activement à l’animation culturelle et sportive bretonne en étant aux côtés de quelque 50 000 associations locales. Il contribue directement à la richesse et à la qualité de la vie associative via « A 100 % pour les associations », opération qu’il a initiée et qui permet de collecter des fonds au profit des associations participantes.

Partenaire des Vieilles Charrues, premier festival musical de France, co-fondateur avec le Conseil régional de la filière d’excellence de course au large Bretagne-Crédit Mutuel, il apporte également son soutien aux clubs de football professionnels de Brest, Guingamp, Lorient et Rennes.  Autant d’initiatives qui, chacune dans leur domaine, contribuent au rayonnement de la Bretagne.


Découvrez les initiatives locales du CMB : http://bit.ly/1HJMl8G

SOYEZ LES PREMIERS INFORMES de nos actualités et retrouvez sur cette page tous nos conseils, bons plans et offres promotionnelles...
Cette page a pour objectif, notamment, de partager avec vous nos évènements mais aussi d'échanger et d'être toujours au plus près de vos préoccupations quotidiennes.


ÉVÉNEMENTS MARQUANTS
Le Crédit Mutuel de Bretagne réinvente l’expérience client au sein de ses nouvelles caisses locales, pour illustrer au mieux son engagement : « Construire chaque jour la banque qui va avec la vie ». Nouveau design, nouveaux espaces : une nouvelle relation bancaire encore plus proche et interactive est née. 
L’histoire commence en octobre 2013 avec la nouvelle caisse locale de Châteaubourg. L’aventure continue ensuite pour le Crédit Mutuel de Bretagne puisque plusieurs sites sont ouverts aux nouvelles couleurs comme à Lannion, à Auray Porte Océane ou encore à Brest Strasbourg.
En effet, l’aménagement habituel de la caisse laisse place à un lieu de vie convivial avec des couleurs vives, un coin presse ou encore un espace projet favorisant la co-construction avec les clients. 
Les outils mis à la disposition du client (tablettes, écrans dynamiques) et le contact avec le conseiller servent, quant à eux, un même objectif : valoriser et renforcer la qualité de la relation client en les accompagnant au mieux. 
Alors venez jouer les curieux, vous vous y sentirez bien, un peu comme chez vous !

name: Port Credit, Ontario
description: Port Credit is a former municipality now located within the city of Mississauga, Ontario, Canada. It is located at the mouth of the Credit River on the north shore of Lake Ontario. Port Credit's boundaries are the Queen Elizabeth Way to the north, Seneca Avenue and the western edge of the Adamson Estate to the east and Godfrey's Lane and the townhouse complex located on the west side of Shawnmarr Road to the west. It had a population of 10,260 at the 2001 census.Port Credit was originally a settlement of the Mississauga Ojibwe first nations band and a trading post established in 1720 for the exchange of goods from the Europeans for furs trapped by the Mississaugas. After the War of 1812, a harbour was established by the Mississaugas together with European settlers. In 1847, the Mississaugas left the village to relocate on the Six Nations Reserve to be with other band members and first nations. Industry was established on the village periphery including an oil refinery, but the village is no longer a substantial industrial district. The village survived into the 20th century, becoming an independent municipality in 1909, until it was merged with the City of Mississauga in 1974.Today, the original core village is now a heritage conservation district. The harbour is mostly used for recreational boating.HistoryThe location of Port Credit was in the 1700s, the land of the Mississauga Ojibwe band. The location became used as a meeting place between the band and white traders, and the river was known to them as the Missinhe or "trusting creek". To the French and later the English the mouth was known as "Port Credit" and a trading post was established in 1720, where goods were traded or bought on credit. The earliest reference is on a map drawn in 1757 by La Broquerie.

name: Credit Suisse
description: Credit Suisse Group is a Switzerland-based multinational financial services holding company, headquartered in Zürich, that operates the Credit Suisse Bank and other financial services investments. The company is organized as a stock corporation with four divisions: Investment Banking, Private Banking, Asset Management, and a Shared Services Group that provides marketing and support to the other three divisions.Credit Suisse was founded by Alfred Escher in 1856 under the name Schweizerische Kreditanstalt (SKA, ) in order to fund the development of Switzerland's rail system. It issued loans that helped create Switzerland's electrical grid and the European rail system. It also helped develop the country's currency system and funded entrepreneurship. In the 1900s Credit Suisse began shifting to retail banking in response to the elevation of the middle-class and the growing popularity of savings accounts. Credit Suisse partnered with First Boston in 1978. After a large failed loan put First Boston under financial stress, Credit Suisse bought a controlling share of the bank in 1988. In the 1990s, Credit Suisse acquired the Winterthur Group, Swiss Volksbank, Swiss American Securities Inc. (SASI) and Bank Leu among others. In the year 2000, it added the U.S. investment firm Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette.The company restructured itself in 2002, 2004 and 2006. It was one of the least affected banks during the global financial crisis, but afterwards began shrinking its investment business, executing layoffs and cutting costs. During the period between 2008 and 2012, Germany, Brazil, and the United States began a series of investigations into the use of Credit Suisse accounts for tax evasion. In May 2014, the company pleaded guilty to decades of conspiring to help US citizens "hide their wealth" in order to avoid taxes, and agreed to pay $2.6 billion in fines.

Since its establishment in 1961, Credit Libanais has proved its leadership position in the Lebanese banking industry through the acquisition of other banks since 1977, the introduction of the electronic Point of Sale (POS) network in 1993, the establishment of the first nation-wide ATM network, International Payment Network (IPN), and the issuance, in 1996, of Euro Certificates of Deposits listed on international stock exchanges, which was the first operation of its kind in Lebanon.
 
The Bank is a pioneer in the field of innovative technological services, including Internet banking, Customer Service Center, Phone banking. This strategy is in line with our customer focus policy which aims at providing customers with convenient access to the Bank from the privacy and comfort of their homes or offices.
 
Credit Libanais has re-aligned its organizational structure in order to enhance customer focus. The resolute perseverance and diligence of Credit Libanais' teams of management and staff are pillar factors the Bank capitalizes on to remain, for the years to come, among the best performing banks in the industry, one that aims at delivering highest standards of quality services to customers in Lebanon and worldwide. By doing so, Credit Libanais ensures sustainable growth for shareholders, stakeholders and employees alike.

name: Qantas Credit Union
description:
Our story began in 1959 when a small group of Qantas employees decided they could develop a better and fairer way of banking, so they pooled their funds together and created Qantas Credit Union.
From those humble beginnings we’ve grown to be one of the biggest Credit Unions in Australia with over 90,000 Members and over $2.79 billion in assets. A lot may have changed since 1959 but one thing still remains true – we never forget who we are or where we’ve come from, remaining firmly focused on our promise to provide our Members with great service and a better deal for all their banking.  
We provide a range of products and services you would expect to find at a bank, but we do it better with great rates and low fees!
Our wide range of retail banking products includes home and investment loans, personal loans, credit cards and deposits; right through to financial planning and Superannuation. 
Although we offer banking products, we’re not a bank!
When you think of banks making huge profits and paying dividends to shareholders - you can think again when it comes to us. We don’t have to make huge profits to pay dividends to shareholders, our shareholders are our Members. 
The great thing is that the profits we make go back into giving back in the form of better rates, fairer fees, and smarter ways of banking. Plus, we do it with a smile! We have some of the friendliest and most experienced people here at Qantas Credit Union, and we’re all here to help Members get the best deal and the best advice.
That’s what it’s all about... ‘a great deal more for your banking!'
We’re also an Authorised Deposit-taking Institution, meaning we’re governed by APRA (the Australian Prudential Regulatory Authority) and just like the banks we’re also required to satisfy the same strong regulatory requirements, including strict prudential standards on capital and liquidity.  
For more information you can visit the corporate site at www.qantascu.com.au


Welcome to the official Qantas Credit Union fan page.  On this page we will be posting information, updates, comments and special offers.
We just have a couple of guidelines to follow when posting on this page, so that everyone feels safe to express themselves  Do
	Share stories, post opinions, make comments
	Be courteous to others when posting
Don’t
	Share your personal information publicly – account details, passwords, phone numbers.  
	Post content that is illegal (e.g. comments that are racist, homophobic, sexist) or that could be viewed as harassment or abuse.  Post links to third party websites such as other commercial organisations, or that could be viewed as spam. Spamming activity will be blocked.
We want this page to be a friendly, supportive community, so we will remove any posts that break these rules.  We will also block repeat offenders.
We’re here to help from 9am to 5pm  Eastern Standard Time, Monday to Friday For compliments and complaints please use our official feedback form (located here https://www.qantascu.com.au/contact-us-compliments-and-complaints.html) and we will get back to you as soon as possible.  

If you require urgent assistance please contact us on 
1300 747 747.

We also, show our client's how to build there existing credit, and how to build new credit. Our goal is to help our clients get better interest rates when buying a vehicle, or show them what it take's to purchase a house.

name: Real Credit Care
description:
Learn How to Boost Your Score With an Expert Credit Analyst - Improving your credit score can have a powerful impact on your financial health. Whether you have a rating so low it seems hopeless, or have good scores but are aiming for excellence, there are effective techniques you can use to regain ownership of your own credit position.
All too often, however, credit and financial professionals create obstacles to our success, persuading consumers that we do not have the tools to improve our scores without spending hundreds or thousands of dollars on professional assistance, or countless hours combing the Internet for the secrets of the trade.

That's where we come in. We provide you with one of the best ways to improve your credit score. We have several clients whom we have help to improve their credit, get them qualified for a home loan, lower their interest rates, and save money!

It's simple: The higher your credit score, the more financially fit you will be. Not only will you have access to higher lines of credit, but you will also save money—potentially thousands of dollars annually—by decreasing interest rates.

You do have the option of hiring a lawyer or even file bankruptcy for you. But why spend a lot of extra money, damaging your credit, when you could just use our services to get the results other companies or lawyers can't do.

name: Elevations Credit Union
description:
Thanks for being part of our Facebook community. We’re your Colorado Front Range credit union, serving Adams, Boulder, Broomfield, Denver, Jefferson, Larimer and Weld Counties. We’re looking forward to sharing financial tips and some of the great events and stories in our communities with you.
 
Founded in 1953 as the University of Colorado Federal Credit Union in Boulder, we’ve grown from 12 members and less than $100 in assets to an institution with more than 110,000 members that manages over $1.5 billion in assets and is the No. 1 credit union mortgage lender in Colorado. 

We provide a broad portfolio of financial products and services including checking and savings accounts, mortgage loans, credit cards, auto loans, home equity lines of credit, student loans, business loans and financial planning. 

We have 11 branch locations along with a nationwide network of CO-OP ATMs and shared branches. Our mobile and online banking, and free bill pay allow members to stay close to their money no matter where they live or where they're traveling.

In 2014, our team earned the prestigious Malcolm Baldrige National Quality Award, and readers of local newspapers name us “Best Bank/Financial Institution,” “Best Mortgage Lender” and “Best Customer Service” year after year. We are a leader in the communities we serve and an employer that over 380 people are proud to work for.

If you’re an Elevations member with a question about your account, please call our Contact Center at 303-443-4672 or toll-free at 800-429-7626, visit https://www.elevationscu.com/contact, or email ecuservice@elevationscu.com. Please be aware that this Facebook page is not a customer service channel— we cannot answer specific account issues on Facebook so refrain from posting account information or any other personal information on our page. 

Our official Facebook team business hours are Monday – Friday, 7:00 a.m. – 7:00 p.m and Saturday, 8:00 a.m. – 1:00 p.m (Mountain time).

Non-deposit investment products and services are offered through CUSO Financial Services, L.P. TFCU provides personal financial services to more than 230,000 members and with roughly $5 billion in assets, we are one of the largest credit unions in the country. TFCU offers financial services to all people and businesses located on Long Island, in Nassau and Suffolk Counties.

As a Credit Union, we put our members first. The end result is a financial institution that has personal service, lower rates on auto loans, Credit Cards and Mortgages, and a home-grown approach.

Fun legal stuff: TFCU does not sell or rent our mailing list or provide any third-party access to your personal information. Your e-mail address is used solely for the TFCU e-mail list. For details on our e-mail practices, please see our TFCU Privacy Policy for more information.

TFCU will never contact members via phone, email, text message or cell phone to request personal information which you must respond to electronically. Information includes account numbers, passwords, debit or credit card numbers, expiration dates or (PIN) personal identification numbers and all that other legal mumbo jumbo.

name: Patelco Credit Union
description:
Like most credit unions, Patelco was founded to serve the financial interests of employees of a particular organization – in our case the Pacific Telephone and Telegraph Company (now part of AT&T). The year was 1936, and Patelco's initial assets totaled a mere $500.

With assets now totaling more than $4 billion and 270,000 members nationwide, we are among the largest credit unions in the nation today. As a, not–for–profit, full–service financial institution, what we earn, we return to our members in savings from lower loan rates, fewer fees, and personalized service that focus on transparency, simplicity, and trust. Deposits with us are federally insured and we are dedicated to helping our members and our communities prosper through volunteer initiatives. We have expanded our field of membership to serve the employees of over 1,000 large and small businesses and communities throughout California and the United States.Patelco Credit Union is dedicated to supporting every aspect of your financial life.

Access: 
Need quick access to your money? Patelco makes it easy with over 40 branches, Online Banking, Mobile Banking , Telephone Banking, over 28,000 CO-OP ATMs, and over 6,000 Credit Union Shared Service Center branches— where you'll never be charged a fee to manage your accounts or access your funds.

Loans for Every Need:
Looking for a home loan, home equity loan, auto loan, personal loan, credit card, or a home equity line of credit? Patelco has you covered, with low rates and exceptional terms.

Savings Products:
If it's saving you'd like to do, we have several savings accounts with varying tiered interest rates, money market accounts, certificates (CDs), and a variety of IRAs to help you save for retirement.

Investments, Insurance, and Financial Advice (through CFS*): 
We can even provide you many different investment and insurance options with free, no obligation consultations from licensed CFS* Financial Advisors, available by appointment at every Patelco branch.

Service

The "People, Not Profits" credit union philosophy extends throughout everything we do. Our employees are dedicated to providing the highest level of service in our branches, on the phone, online, and wherever we can help you make the most of your financial future. After all, since Patelco is member-owned, we truly do work for you. 

Are you getting everything you want from your financial institution?

If you're already a member, make sure you take advantage of the whole suite of amazing products and services Patelco has to offer. Bundling together all of your financial needs in one place is an easy way to keep better track of your money and most likely save some time along the way.

And if you're not a member, what are you waiting for? Join today! 

www.patelco.org/whyjoin 

*Non-deposit investment products and services are offered through CUSO Financial Services, L.P. (“CFS”), a registered broker-dealer (Member - FINRA/SIPC) and SEC Registered Investment Advisor.  Products offered through CFS: are not NCUA/NCUSIF or otherwise federally insured, are not guarantees or obligations of the credit union, and may involve investment risk including possible loss of principal. Investment Representatives are registered through CFS. (Patelco Credit Union) has contracted with CFS to make non-deposit investment products and services available to credit union members.

Representatives are licensed in the state of CA.

Our Guidelines -- 

•	There are certain rules we have to follow when it comes to what we can say in these forums, so please understand we may not respond to every post.

•	At times, we may remove posts that are inappropriate or in violation of our guidelines. Out of consideration for other members in our online community, please be respectful and avoid offensive, graphic, obscene, racial, or defamatory language. Stay on topic and keep it clean!

•	We can't service accounts or provide in-depth financial advice via Facebook or any other social media channel, so if you'd like to make a transaction or have any related questions, please visit a branch or call us at 800.358.8228.

•	We will never request sensitive information such as account, social security, or PIN numbers via email, social media, or any other online medium, so please do not post this information in these forums.

•	We may occasionally direct you to third-party links or sites to share interesting articles or websites on topics of potential interest to you, but we don't necessarily endorse all views or offers on these sites.

•	Check out our privacy and security policies, and keep in mind we cannot be held responsible for how your information will be used by non–Patelco sites, or the security of contents accessed through third-party links.

•	Please keep in mind that other Patelco members who have subscribed to our updates can view personal information visible on your wall or timeline (including, but not limited to, your gender, age, occupation, and place of employment). Please avoid sharing personal information that you'd prefer to remain confidential.

•	While we participate in these social media venues we do not have any control of and cannot be held responsible for their content.

•	Content that seeks to defame or defraud any financial, commercial, or non-governmental agency is prohibited.

•	Solicitations and/or advertisements are not allowed. 

•	Participation on the Patelco Credit Union Facebook page is done so at your own risk; when you participate, you take responsibility for your posts/comments, your username, and any information you provide.

•	When you submit content, you grant Patelco Credit Union the right to use the content in any and all Patelco websites, including social media channels, print, and other media, including your likeness (your profile photograph/picture), without compensation or any other considerations.

name: Credit manager
description: Credit management is the process of controlling and collecting payments from customers. This is the function within a bank or company to control credit policies that will improve revenues and reduce financial risks. A credit manager is a person employed by an organization to manage the credit department and make decisions concerning credit limits, acceptable levels of risk and terms of payment to their customers. In companies, the role of Credit manager is variable in its scope. Credit managers are responsible for:Controlling bad debt exposure and expenses, through the direct management of credit terms on the company's ledgers.Maintaining strong cash flows through efficient collections. The efficiency of cash flow is measured using various methods, most common of which is Days Sales Outstanding (DSO).Ensuring an adequate Allowance for Doubtful Accounts is kept by the company.Monitoring the Accounts Receivable portfolio for trends and warning signs.Enforcing the "stop list" of supply of goods and services to customers.Determine credit ceilings.Setting credit-rating criteria.Setting and ensuring compliance with a corporate credit policy.Obtaining security interests where necessary. Common examples of this could be PPSA's, letters of credit or personal guarantees.Initiating legal or other recovery actions against customers who are delinquent. Credit managers tend to fall into one of two groups due to the differing specialty legal and jurisdictional knowledge required:  Commercial Credit Managers Consumer Credit ManagersCompanies which sell to both markets will require a Credit manager familiar with both aspects of Credit management.AustraliaCredit managers in Australia obtain memberships from the Australian Institute of Credit Management . Qualifications and continuing education can also be obtained from here.

name: Hudson Valley Federal Credit Union
description:
Hudson Valley Federal Credit Union Social Media Policy

The following terms apply to any participation in social media sites maintained by Hudson Valley Federal Credit Union (HVFCU). These sites include HVFCU’s Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter pages, as well as similar online forums in which the Credit Union may participate in the future.  

HVFCU invites the public–both members and non-members—to participate in its social media platforms. To ensure these open forums remain positive and civil, the following content as determined by HVFCU is prohibited and will be promptly removed:  

- Offensive language or photographs, 
- Personal attacks and defamatory comments,
- Non-HVFCU Advertisements,
- Spam, 
- HTML and URL links, 
- Content which encourages or condones illegal or unethical activity, 
- Off-topic comments that diverge from the theme of the forum or particular discussion thread, and
- Personal, confidential, or proprietary information     

HVFCU may remove any content from its online forums at its sole and unrestricted discretion.    Violators of this policy may be blocked from positing additional content. Depending on the circumstances, HVFCU may report the violator to the administrator of the forum or to law enforcement officials.   

Any content submitted on HVFCU’s online forums becomes the property of HVFCU. By posting on HVFCU’s forums, you agree that HVFCU may use the content for any purpose without consideration or payment.  

HVFCU employees posting on its online forums do so in their individual capacities, not as representatives of HVFCU. Only the site manager or her/his designee may utilize HVFCU’s social media accounts and post content on behalf of HVFCU. In addition to the provisions of this policy, employees shall adhere to the policies expressed in the HVFCU employee handbook, as well as any directives issued by supervisors. 

HVFCU may amend this policy at any time.  Participants use HVFCU online forums at their own risk and acknowledge that HVFCU cannot prevent every violation of this policy. HVFCU does not assume responsibility for any direct or consequential damages which may result from unauthorized or inappropriate posts.     

For any questions related to this policy, please call 845.463.3011 or 800.468.3011.

name: Port Credit Secondary School
description: Port Credit Secondary School is a high school located in the city of Mississauga, Ontario, and is a part of the Peel District School Board. It was the first secondary school in Peel, celebrating its 90th anniversary in May 2010. It is located just north of Port Credit, Ontario. It is home to two Peel Region programs, the SciTech Program and the Strings Program.The current PCSS building is located about one block east of Hurontario Street at 70 Mineola Rd. East. The school is nestled within a wealthy well-established neighbourhood, known as Mineola, that is east of Hurontario Street, north of the CN Railroad and south of the Queen Elizabeth Way. The original location of the school was on Forest Avenue, on the site of what is now Mentor College. The school moved to its current location, May 13, 1963.The student body is ethnically diverse. The school's athletic teams are known as the Warriors and have been known to win many regional tournaments. The Ultimate Frisbee team won the regional championship during the 2009-2010 season. In 2011, PCSS Warriors became the first ever Ultimate ROPSSAA Champions, winning the finals 14-13 in super sudden death overtime over the number one seeded Erindale Secondary School. The Warriors won their second ultimate frisbee title in 2014 and finished the season with an undefeated record of 11-0.PCSS was a shooting location for the 2006 film The Naked Mile. In October 20, 2007, the school was used as a filming location for the film True Confessions of a Hollywood Starlet.

From the school employees who made deposits and received loans in the 1930s, SchoolsFirst FCU has grown into a full service financial institution that helps nearly 500,000 Members organize and integrate every part of their financial lives. 

Because Membership is strictly limited to school employees and their immediate family, we’ve developed a unique set of products and services, from a no-interest loan for teachers to purchase supplies for their classroom, to a higher-dividend savings account to set aside money for the summer months, to loan payment deferrals for school employees affected by furloughs or layoffs.

As a financial cooperative, our excess earnings are returned to our Members in the form of better rates and lower fees. Whenever possible, we don’t charge a fee for our services, like free coin-counting machines in branches, free checking, and no balance transfer fees or cash advance fees on our credit cards. 

SchoolsFirst FCU is an Equal Housing Lender.

name: Metro Credit Union
description:
Our History
When you take a look at the history of Metro Credit Union, you discover that our story is really a tale of two financial institutions. Nearly 60 years ago (1951), Safeway Food Stores of Omaha was granted a charter to form a credit union designed to serve the financial needs of their employees. A short while later (1952), employees of the University of Nebraska Medical Center came upon a similar idea, that creating a credit union would provide both themselves and their co-workers with an alternative for value-priced financial services. With that, the University of Nebraska Medical Center Federal Credit Union was born.

These two separate institutions operated both individually and successfully for many years until 1982, when a decision by Safeway Food Store executives eliminated retail operations in Nebraska. The move left Safeway Omaha Employees Federal Credit Union with a weighty decision... How best to continue as a viable financial institution? The answer came in the form of a merger. And, in 1982 Safeway Omaha Employees FCU and the University of Nebraska Medical Center FCU joined forces to become one.

As a result of the merger, a new name (Metro Health Services Federal Credit Union) was selected for the newly formed institution. In that year, assets totaled $10 million with the credit union operating out of two small offices. As the credit union grew, so did the list of available member services, including the addition of mortgage lending products in 1987. Shortly thereafter (1988) the credit union opened a new Saddle Creek office which proved to be a launching pad for significant growth. New offices were added in '95, '01, '07 and '11 to bring the current total of branch offices to six.

Today, with over 30,000 members, Metro Credit Union is the third largest credit union operating in Nebraska. Assets currently exceed $228 million and the list of available products and services rivals that of any area financial institution. Despite this growth, the goal of providing our members with value-priced financial services all delivered with friendly personal service has remained intact.

name: Credit Union Cherry Blossom Ten Mile Run
description:
The Credit Union Cherry Blossom 10 Mile Run is an annual 10-mile (16 km) road race in Washington, D.C.The Gala 40th running was held on April 1, 2012. The 41st running will be on April 7, 2013. 

Founded in 1973 as a precursor training run for local runners planning to compete in the Boston Marathon, the race has evolved over the years into a major event  attracting 15,000 runners from all 50 states and around the world. The race is so popular that entrants are selected through a lottery system held in December. Over 30,000 runners apply for spots on the starting line. 

The Credit Union Cherry Blossom 10 Mile Run is the only running event in the Washington, DC area which features a significant number of world class runners who compete for over $45,000 in prize money.

The race serves as a vehicle for the title sponsoring Credit Union Miracle Day to raise funds for the Children's Miracle Network. Since 2002 over $5 million dollars has been raised.

The race is scheduled for the first Sunday of each April to coincide with the blooming of the cherry trees, given as a gift in 1912 from the mayor of Tokyo. It is part of the National Cherry Blossom Festival which takes place in late March and early April in the city.

The course is flat, fast, and certified. Landmarks along the route include the Jefferson Memorial, the Franklin Delano Roosevelt Memorial, the Washington Monument, Arlington National Cemetery, the Lincoln Memorial, the Watergate complex, and the Tidal Basin.

There is also a non-competitive 5K Run-Walk and a Half Mile Kids Run conducted on race morning.

name: San Dionisio Credit Cooperative (SDCC)
description:
History of San Dionisio Credit Cooperative

During the scouting activity of the Rover Scouts in Corregidor and Bataan, Fr. Walter Hogan asked those coming from San Dionisio what activities were being undertaken by the group in their community. They responded that based on the Rover Scouts' doctrine, their activities revolved around service, love of God & love of country.

Thus, such community projects as artesian wells, playgrounds, basketball courts and cleanliness of environment were realized.

Fr. Hogan introduced the concept of Cooperatives which the group agreed with. One of the Rover Scouts who was also a member of an institutional cooperative, introduced the group to Fr. Gaston Duchesneau, a Jesuit priest who was then the director of the Institute of the Social Order (ISO).

Dr. Angel Mendoza, who was a barrio lieutenant at that time, called for an assembly to address the needs of the community, particularly the need for organizing a cooperative. Although many of those present agreed, there were also those who were against the concept because most of them were already old and thus not up to the task anymore. Mr. Jaime Ferrer, a strict disciplinarian, who was a leader of the Hunter’s ROTC guerrillas in Parañaque and a colleague of Dr. Angel Mendoza in Club Tamorgo, boosted the morale of those who were interested.

There were forty five (45) participants who attended the seminar for nine (9) consecutive Fridays, only twenty eight (28) of whom were able to finish it. The speaker of the said seminar was Fr. Gaston Duchesneau, assisted by St. Andrew Asst. Parish Priest, Fr. Francis Witizelae.

At last, San Dionisio Cooperative Credit Union, Inc. (SDCCUI) was organized on July 28, 1961 by the twenty eight (28) founding members with three hundred eighty (P 380.00) pesos as starting capital. It was subsequently registered with the Cooperative Administration Office (CAO) on September 8, 1961.

The name San Dionisio Cooperative Credit Union, Inc. was named after the Patron Saint of Bgy. San Dionisio,   St. Dionysius .

THE FOUNDING MEMBERS

At first, the CAO was reluctant to register SDCCUI, because of the provision in the by-laws about minor depositors. It was also the first time ever that a community cooperative was organized. Later, however, the CAO agreed.

On October 4, 1973 San Dionisio Cooperative Credit Union Inc. was re-registered with the Bureau of Agricultural Cooperatives Development (BACOD). Later on, the cooperative was re-registered with the Cooperative Development Authority (CDA) under R.A. 6938 and 6939 bearing the name San Dionisio Credit Cooperative (SDCC).

On October 16, 2009, SDCC was again registered with the CDA under R.A. 9520, also known as the Philippine Cooperative Code of 2008.

It may be worthwhile to note that with the help of the Varsitarians, a Parañaque civic club, the neighboring barangays of San Dionisio such as Tambo, Don Galo, Sto.Niño, La Huerta and Las Piñas were motivated to organize their own cooperatives during the early 60’s.

THE GROWING PROCESS

When San Dionisio Credit Cooperative (SDCC) was formed, there were negative attitudes like: “Walang humawak ng palayok na hindi naulingan ang kamay” Nobody borrows from a cooperative; and the issue on credibility.

However, SDCC was able to overcome those problems and challenges under the stewardship of Mr. Herminio C. Hernandez in his capacity as General Manager. In 1961, upon the request of the Board of Directors, he started with his voluntary service for 11 years up to 1972. He then gave up his well-paying job as an accountant in a shipping firm to work for the cooperative as its full-time General Manager, even with a lower compensation.

The following are the factors that contributed to the slow but sure growth of San Dionisio Credit Cooperative:

1. Adherence to the Coop Philosophy and Principles
2. Transparency of the officers and management
3. Strong spirit of volunteerism
4. Bottom-up principle

At present, San Dionisio Credit Cooperative is one of the oldest and most successful cooperatives in the Philippines, and is an outstanding example of a true-blooded cooperative that practices good governance thru its structure, systems, policies and programs. It is a cooperative that is committed to serve its members and community with integrity.

name: Kern Schools Federal Credit Union
description:
Kern Schools Federal Credit Union is a full-service financial institution founded in 1938 (we received our federal charter in 1940) by a small group of teachers who met for the purpose of organizing a financial cooperative for Kern County public school teachers. Our first Credit Union “office” was a tiny room in the library of Bakersfield High School, and our one-person staff was an unpaid volunteer. At the end of our first year of operations, Kern Schools consisted of 141 members with $1,336.84 in assets. 

Simply stated, a lot has changed since our very humble beginnings, but the commitment to our Members has remained the same. Today, we are the largest member-owned financial institution in Kern County with over 160,000 Members and over $1.2 billion in assets. Our staff of one unpaid volunteer has grown to over four hundred (400) team members, all with the purpose of providing the best Member service possible. 

Come find out what over 160,000 Kern County residents already know— Kern Schools is the “Best Financial Institution in Kern County!”






POSTING GUIDELINES:

Our Facebook page is public, which means anyone can see your posts on Facebook and your posts may even show up in search engine results. Since this is an open forum to the public, we want to make this a friendly and healthy environment that fosters wholesome discussions and respectful posts and/or comments. We will be monitoring these discussions, posts, and comments and will remove any items that we, in our sole and absolute discretion, feel do not foster the environment we intend on providing. Although we reserve the absolute right to remove any offending material, we offer you the following as some of the guidelines we will use:
•	Keep all content clean and not obscene, explicit, racial, or disparaging in any form
•	Stay on topic and be respectful to others
•	Do not be abusive, hurtful, inflammatory, or defamatory
•	Do not submit content which is not your own, including copyrighted materials of others
•	No solicitations, spam, or advertisements are permitted
•	Never post personal, confidential, or secure information
Our Facebook page is not to be used to submit any claims, demands or requests to Kern Schools, nor should it be used to report phishing or criminal activity. Participation on Facebook is done at your own risk and Kern Schools shall not be responsible for any views expressed, other than by Kern School’s authorized personnel. Kern Schools is not responsible for nor do we endorse any ads, advice, opinions, recommendations, or content placed by Facebook or any other third party on this page or any external links on this site. Kern Schools is not responsible for the privacy and security of this site, or other third party sites, and we urge you to review the privacy and security policies of this site (https://www.facebook.com/about/privacy/) and any third party site you may access. If you have any questions or comments regarding our Facebook page, please feel free to contact Marketing/Business Development at 661-833-7900, ext. 6100 during our regular business hours.

Astfel, fiecare persoană va beneficia de un credit adaptat nevoilor și cerințelor sale de viață.
3. Servicii variate - SudRezidentialBroker dispune de mai multe tipuri de servicii. Mai mult decât atât, având la bază o comunicare foarte bună cu toate companiile bancare din Romania, putem oferi posibilitatea de a alege rapid cea mai bună soluție în materie de produse și servicii: credite Prima Casă, credite ipotecare, credite de nevoi personale, credite Auto, carduri de credit, asigurări RCA, asigurări CASCO, asigurări de bunuri, asigurări de locuințe, de viață, medicale, etc.
4. Eliminarea stresului- Majoritatea oamenilor devin foarte stresați atunci când depun un dosar la bancă. Este foarte solicitant pentru client să cunoască exact documentele necesare pentru un credit, costurile, veniturile necesare, cât durează procesarea dosarului etc.
Deasemenea în ziua de astazi, atât lipsa timpului cât și stresul cotidian ne afectează din ce în ce mai mult. Specialiștii SudRezidentialBroker, lucreză pentru client, în timp ce acesta se poate bucura liniștit de lucrurile cu adevarat importante din viața sa.
5. Servicii Extra- SudRezidentialBroker este o divizie financiară, având ca partener principalul promotor imobiliar al Zonei de Sud a Bucureștiului, respectiv SudRezidential.ro Astfel SudRezidential, vine în ajutorul clienților  pentru a alege cea mai bună ofertă imobiliară și pot beneficia gratuit de tururi ale anbamblurilor rezidențiale din Zona de Sud.

It was officially opened on November 5, 1985. It is currently ranked as the best hospital in the Greater Toronto Area. Credit Valley Hospital merged with Trillium Health Centre on December 1, 2011 to form Trillium Health Partners.ServicesThe hospital provides services and covers areas of medicine including: Cardiac servicesContinuing care/rehabilitationEmergencyGeneral medicineGeneticsMental healthDiagnostic ImagingObstetrics and gynecologyOncologyPaediatricsRenal dialysisSurgery The hospital is equipped with a helipad.ExpansionThe hospital has expanded to include a new cancer treatment centre (The Carlo Fidani Peel Regional Cancer Centre) and also a regional maternal child care program. The cancer centre serves a catchment area of 1.6 million people. In addition to chemotherapy, there are six linear accelerators (radiation treatment machines).

name: Ascend Federal Credit Union
description:
Thanks for visiting the official Ascend Federal Credit Union Facebook page. We are excited to hear from you!

We desire to keep our Facebook page an open forum; however, we do intend to maintain a family friendly atmosphere, so we request that you use appropriate language when posting and/or commenting on our wall. We welcome all questions, commentary, and constructive feedback and don’t take moderating posts lightly. However, Ascend reserves the right to remove any posts that don’t adhere to our guidelines and to block anyone who violates them repeatedly. Specifically we will remove postings that include:

(1)	Content we deem abusive, harassing, stalking, threatening, disparaging, or attacking others.

(2)	Content we deem defamatory, offensive, obscene, vulgar, or depicting violence.

(3)	Content that seeks to defame or defraud any financial, commercial, or non-governmental agency.

(4)	Content that suggests or encourages any illegal activity.

(5)	Content that contains spam or is intended to cause disruptions to this page.

(6)	Content that violates any law, regulation, or Ascend's guidelines.

(7)	Commercial solicitation or solicitation of donations.

(8)	Link baiting (embedding a link in your post or comment intended to direct traffic to your own site.)

DISCLAIMER: In addition to the rights you grant Facebook, by posting to this page or tagging this page in your posts you grant Ascend  a royalty-free license to use your posted content (including, but not limited to, your profile pictures, name, images, ideas, and text) in any manner or media, globally, forever, without any liability or obligation by Ascend to you. 

If you would like to view Ascend’s Privacy Policy you can do so by clicking here: http://www.ascendfcu.org/home/pas 

Serving members is Ascend’s top priority. If you have any concerns or need assistance with Ascend’s products, please call 800-342-3086. 

We monitor this Facebook page for support questions from 8:30 a.m. to 5:15 p.m. CST, Monday through Friday, excluding federal holidays.

If you have any questions or concerns about our Facebook page, please contact us via private message and we will be happy to respond.

name: Crédit Mutuel Kampuchea
description:
Crédit Mutuel Kampuchea (CMK), opened in Cambodia in 2004 by Crédit Mutuel, the second largest cooperative bank in France through the Centre International du Crédit Mutuel (CICM), is a cooperative group that belongs to its members who share common interests. 

Members are the only CMK's shareholders. By becoming a member, you are involved in the affairs of your local Branch by expressing your opinion during the General Assembly and by electing the person who will represent you on the board of directors of your branch. 

CMK's objective is to provide access to savings, credit and banking services to everyone especially the less privileged population.

Crédit Mutuel Kampuchea is registered at the National Bank of Cambodian and with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Royal Government of Cambodia. It is supported by French embassy in Cambodia and l'Agence Française de Développement (AFD).

name: Mundo Credit

Somos una empresa formada y conducida por profesionales que desarrollaron su experiencia en compañías líderes del rubro (concesionarios oficiales de automotor, capitalización, ahorro, consultoras de recursos humanos entre otros) y que entienden la necesidad de cumplir con el sueño de un 0km desde el inicio de tramite hasta la entrega de llave en mano.-

Un sistema que entiende todas posibilidades de pagos de cada cliente, donde los requisitos no son un impedimento a la hora de concretar una operación, donde cada suscriptor puede realizar toda la gestión desde su domicilio desde suscribirse hasta recibir su unidad.-
Es por ello que adecuamos un sistema de financiación UNICA por sus caracteristicas que se adapta a las condiciones del pais y las necesidades de cada cliente, dado a que a travez de nuestro sistema el cliente, elige el vehiculo, el valor mensual que puede abonar ( acorde al vehiculo a retirar) y ademas 3 formas de retirar su proximo 0KM o USADO EXCLUSIVO.

name: ACBA-CREDIT AGRICOLE BANK
description: Բանկը հիմնադրվել է 1996թ. Եվրամիության TACIS ծրագրի շրջանակներում: Հիմնադրումից հետո շուրջ 3 տարի Բանկը զբաղվում էր միայն կարճաժամկետ գյուղատնտեսական ծրագրերի ֆինանսավորմամբ: 1999թ. Բանկն առաջինն էր ՀՀ բանկային համակարգում, որ սկսեց տրամադրել փոքր ու միջին բիզնեսի զարգացման վարկեր: Ֆրանսիական Credit Agricole բանկային խմբի UCABAIL լիզինգային գործառնություններում մասնագիտացած կազմակերպության ակտիվ մասնակցությամբ 2003թ. Հայաստանում հիմնադրվեց «ԱԳԲԱ-Լիզինգ» ՓԲԸ վարկային կազմակերպությունը: Ընդ որում «ԱԳԲԱ-Լիզինգը» առաջինն էր մեր երկրում, որ սկսեց մատուցել լիզինգային ծառայություններ: ACBA բանկի և աշխարհի խոշորագույն բանկերից մեկի` ֆրանսիական Կրեդիտ Ագրիկոլ բանկային խմբի միջև երկար տարիների փոխշահավետ համագործակցությունը հանգեցրին նրան, որ 2006թ. սեպտեմբերին Կրեդիտ Ագրիկոլ բանկային խումբը դարձավ բանկի ամենախոշոր փայատերը` իրականացնելով նշանակալից ֆինանսական ներդրում Բանկի կապիտալում: ACBA բանկը վերակազմավորվեց փակ բաժնետիրական ընկերության և վերանվանվեց ԱԿԲԱ-ԿՐԵԴԻՏ ԱԳՐԻԿՈԼ ԲԱՆԿ: Բանկը միակն է ՀՀ բանկային համակարգում, որ անդամակցում է միջազգային երեք խոշորագույն` VISA, MasterCard և American Express վճարային համակարգերին:

name: Generations Federal Credit Union
description: Established in 1940, Generations Federal Credit Union serves the Bexar County region with an award-winning suite of consumer, commercial and youth banking products and services, including savings, checking, lending and credit cards.

name: Truity Credit Union
description:
Truity Credit Union was founded in 1939 by the Jane Phillips Sorority in Bartlesville, OK. Mildred Hunt was the first treasurer and during her lunch break and after hours she conducted credit union business at her desk in the pipeline department at Phillips Petroleum Company. At that time a single quarter opened a savings account and allowed members to obtain unsecured loans up to $50. From these beginnings we have developed into a full service financial institution. Truity Credit Union is a "not for profit, but for service" cooperative financial institution. We offer a full range of financial services to our members including basic savings and checking accounts, mortgage loans, complex investment planning, and much more. Our members are our owners, there are no "shareholders" controlling the Credit Union. Each member has one vote and equal ownership. This allows us the freedom to concentrate on our most important asset, our members. By reinvesting profits back into our membership group we are able to have fewer fees and better rates. We promise to treat you with respect, to be accurate and secure with your information, and make it easy for you to do business with us. We are proud to be part of America's credit union movement, where people really are worth more than money.

Visit us and find out more: http://www.TruityCU.org

name: Verve a Credit Union
description:
Verve, a Credit Union, is guided by seven Cooperative Principles that helped form the basis for credit unions and other cooperatives back in the 1800s. To this day, these principles continue to form the foundation on which Verve provides benefits to its members. They also provide the standard against which the credit union is operated.

This is the official Facebook Fan Page of Verve, a Credit Union.  The purpose of our Fan Page is to share information with our member-owners and those in the communities that we serve.  We reserve the right to remove any post we deem to be derogatory or explicit in nature.  We will never share our member's personal information and we ask that everyone who visits our page protects themselves and their personal information by never sharing your account number or any information that may increase your chances of becoming a victim of identity theft.  If you have a question about your account, please email us at newmedia@verveacu.com or call us at 800-448-9228.  Thank you for being a Fan!

name: Educators Credit Union
description:
We are a credit union, not a bank....but what does that really mean??

Our guiding principal is to be “Not for Profit, Not for Charity, But for Service." We are here for the members...YOU!

How We Are Different (What You Should Expect):

First Class Service—Educators focuses on you, our member/owners, and your specific financial needs.

Exceptional Educational Resources—Complimentary workshops and guides show you how to save money when buying a car or home, investing or budgeting your money, or just to better understand financial products and matters.

Competitive Rates—We want to be the leader in providing you with the best rates possible on savings accounts and consumer loan products.

Limited Fees and Minimum Balance Requirements—Educators has very few minimum balance requirements, and our fees are much lower than other financials.

Ready to “quit your bank”? Head to www.ecu.com/inside/locations to find 1 of our 17 branch locations!!

Our difference is measured heavily from ongoing member feedback—We care about what you have to say! In finding out your needs, we have achieved one of the highest satisfaction ratings for financial institutions in the country. So...no holding back! Say it :o)


During each stage of your life, you will encounter financial challenges. Three of the most important milestones in life are putting a roof over your head, raising a family and assuring a comfortable retirement. All financial products designed for these areas were made to be as quick and convenient as possible and priced to save you money. Check with us during all your financial milestones to see how we can help you save money.

Besides the typical financial services you’re used to, here is a brief list of some of the unique services that you’ll find at Educators:

What’s Your Score? —Get your free credit report and credit score, along with information on how you can improve or maintain your current credit score.
Change Up® —Your debit card “credit” purchases are rounded to the next dollar and deposited into a separate higher rate savings account to help you easily build your savings.
ScoreCard® —Earn reward points with your credit or debit card purchases that can be used for travel, merchandise, cash, or Educators product/service discounts or special interest rates.
VIP Savings Account —Designed to help you save money in any amount, small or large, by “locking in” a higher rate savings account for 12 months. We’ll even add a bonus if you make monthly deposits and no withdrawals!
Identity Theft 911 —Assistance program if you ever become a victim of identity theft or fraud.

For more information go to: https://www.ecu.com or just ask!!

This credit union is federally insured by the National Credit Union Administration
 Educators Credit Union is an equal housing lender

name: Nuevo Credito Mivivienda
description:
¿Por qué el Nuevo Crédito MIVIVIENDA es incomparable?

1.- Cuotas fijas y en soles para que pagues siempre lo mismo.
2.- Un Premio al Buen Pagador de S/.12,500 que reduce tu cuota mensual desde el primer mes. Este premio es otorgado si financias tu crédito en un plazo igual o mayor a 10 años y se mantiene siempre y cuando seas puntual en el pago de tus cuotas.
3.- Poder pedirlo a nivel nacional en la entidad financiera que quieras (Bancos, Financieras, Edpymes, Cajas Municipales de Ahorro y Crédito, Cajas Rurales de Ahorro y Crédito, Cooperativas de Ahorro y Crédito o Empresas Administradoras Hipotecarias).
4.- Financiar tu casa o departamento hasta por el 90% de su valor, siempre que éste sea mayor a S/.50,400 y hasta S/.180,000.
5.- Un plazo para pagar de 10 a 20 años, con alternativa de prepago.
6.- Poder adquirir tu vivienda terminada, en construcción o en proyecto de primera venta donde quieras.
7.- Si la compras en planos o aún está en construcción, si lo solicitas, tienes un periodo de gracia para empezar a pagarla 6 meses después.
8.- Durante dicho periodo, no pagarás el principal ni los intereses. Los intereses generados durante este plazo se capitalizarán incorporándose al importe del crédito otorgado.

name: United Credit Union
description: From totally free checking accounts to affordable car loans and credit cards, we are here to meet your financial needs!   We don't just say we will give you the best service, we live, breathe and smile for you and your finances every day!   So if you're tired of the same old song and dance with all kinds of fees and non-personal service, make the switch to United Credit Union today!

name: SafetyNet Credit
description:
Manage

Ever paid unauthorised overdraft fees? 
SafetyNet Credit helps prevent unauthorised overdraft fees by connecting to your bank account. When your bank balance gets too low, we can deposit funds into your bank to stop you going beyond your limit (requires autodeposit function enabled).

Borrow

If approved, SafetyNet Credit will offer you a credit limit of up to £500. You can borrow up to your credit limit at any time by logging into your dashboard and requesting funds. There are no deposit fees and funds are normally transferred within 15 minutes. Simply pay 1% per day and never any other fees. Ever.

Repay

SafetyNet Credit takes its repayments when you receive money into your bank account. We will never take you beyond your overdraft limit when taking a repayment (that's what we're trying to avoid!) and any principal that is paid goes straight back into your available credit.

name: Credit Europe Bank
description: Credit Europe Bank is a Dutch registered bank owned by the Turkish financial holding company FIBA Group. The bank is focused on corporate lending as well as on retail banking and operates in the euro-zone countries of the Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, Malta as well as in China, Dubai, Russia, Romania, Switzerland and Ukraine. The bank's strategy is to offer easy-to-use retail banking and SME products as well as private banking. It also offers trade finance and corporate banking services.It was originally the foreign units of Turkish bank Finansbank, but was renamed as Credit Europe Bank in 2007 when that bank was sold to a Greek bank and the foreign units split into a new bank with headquarters in Amsterdam.HistoryThe banking group was first known as Finansbank N.V. and was incorporated on 24 February 1994. The bank has had a full banking license in The Netherlands since 1994 and is supervised by the Dutch Central Bank, De Nederlandsche Bank.In 2007 the bank was rebranded as Credit Europe Bank N.V., after Finansbank was sold to the National Bank of Greece. The brand 'Finansbank' was also included in the deal, leading to all branches were renamed into Credit Europe Bank.OperationsCorporate bankingCredit Europe Bank offers corporate banking services and products such as working capital and project finance loans, syndicated loans and factoring services. In addition, CEB has valuable experience in structured trade and commodity finance.

name: American Credit Acceptance
description: American Credit Acceptance is a deep sub-prime auto finance company providing targeted financing solutions nationwide. We start with a common sense lending approach for our dealer partners and end with an affordable payment program for our customers. We strive to be the leading provider of financing solutions in the sub-prime automotive marketplace.

name: First Community Credit Union
description:
First Community is a cooperative, owned and operated by its members. Members put their money in a variety of savings accounts, and in turn, that money is lent to members. After operating expenses and reserve requirements are met, loan income is returned to all members in the form of competitive dividends and comprehensive financial services. This is what distinguishes First Community from other financial institutions.

First Community is a $2 billion financial institution with nearly 250,000 members, serving all of St. Louis County, St. Louis City, Franklin County, Jefferson County, St. Charles County, Warren County, and the Illinois counties of Madison, Monroe and St. Clair. We are the largest credit union in Missouri and amongst the Top 10 financial institutions in the region. Our membership continues to grow as we fulfill our mission to provide quality products and affordable financial services for over 80 years.

We strive to keep on the cutting-edge of banking technology, and are proud to provide our members with innovative products like our interest-bearing First Rate Checking and mobile banking with remote deposit capture. Our professional staff has years of experience in all-things financial. Yet, when you visit our branches you'll find that they are friendly and courteous, and will make you feel right at home. After all, they are members just like you.

name: Navy Army Community Credit Union
description:
Navy Army Community Credit Union was chartered on January 28, 1955 as Naval Employees Corpus Christi Federal Credit Union. Over the years, through careful management, outstanding customer service and supportive membership, we have grown to be become the largest credit union in the Corpus Christi area. 

Membership has grown to over 100,000. Deposits and assets are over $1.5 BILLION as of July 2012. We have 10 branch locations located in the Coastal Bend, with a full service Mortgage Center for our real estate loans. Recently, we opened our second branch in the Rio Grande Valley located in the Paseo Real Shopping Center, 2100 FM 802 Ste.2055, in Brownsville. Our McAllen branch is located at 4015 North 10th St. in the Northcross Shopping Center. 

Staff has grown to over 300 employees and keeps growing daily! Navy Army Community Credit Union is governed by the Texas Credit Union Department (TCUD), and insured by the National Credit Union Administration’s National Credit Union Share Insurance Fund (NCUSIF) up to at least $250,000. 

Our members are our owners and that is truly what sets us apart from other financial institutions. Our mission is to provide the best possible products and service at all times. From firemen, to nurses, to teachers, to dog catchers, and, yes, to military personnel; we welcome everyone to Navy Army Community Credit Union. We always have room for more.

name: Bad Credit No Credit
description:
No guitars!

"Straight from Brooklyn's DIY scene, Bad Credit No Credit marches onto the stage in a wave of cheerful provocation, combination of socio/political consciousness and a blatant lack of inhibitions. The groovy brass-based septet is fiercely led by its charismatic singer/sax player Carrie-Anne Murphy, who seemingly can sing but would much rather scream and roar her discontent, telling tales of alienation, misogyny and other delights to the sounds of punk-infused jazz and instrumental freakouts. Which is just fine, as it makes for a most convincing (and entertaining!) performance."
--Deli Magazine

name: Greater Nevada Credit Union

We are Greater Nevada Credit Union, open to everyone in Nevada. We have locations in Carson City, Reno, Minden, Dayton, Sparks, Ely, Elko and Wendover.

name: Monaghan Credit Union
description:
The Credit Union movement was introduced into Ireland in 1958 by Nora Herilhy with the support of a number of other dedicated pioneers.

Since then, the Credit Union philosophy of mutual self-help has proved very popular, and there are now over 530 Credit Unions affiliated to the Irish league of Credit Unions throughout the country.

In Ireland over 2.9 million members have recognized the value of credit unions, and have savings approaching €11.9 billion with their credit unions. There are over 9,200 active volunteers involved in the movement, and over 3,500 people are employed (ILCU – Jan 2010).
